preqs: At least two of BMS2052, BMS2062, MCB2011, MCB2022, MIC2011, MIC2022, MOL2011 and MOL2022

rules.ruleString: Must have passed 2 (I/W) units in {BMS2052, BMS2062, MCB2011, MCB2022, MIC2011, MIC2022, MOL2011, MOL2022}

description: The unit will cover molecular aspects of virus replication and introduce students to the mechanisms used by viruses to infect hosts and cause disease. The focus will be on human and animal viruses and will include the most up-to-date research as well as areas of major worldwide concern, such as emerging viral infections. The molecular properties used by different viruses for infection, replication and transmission will be presented. Theory will be underpinned by practical experiments that will provide experience in working with viruses, in addition to a variety of current hierological techniques used in research and diagnostic laboratories.
